intro: Cotoneaster kitaibelii, commonly known as the Kitaibel's cotoneaster, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its dense, spherical growth habit and showy red berries. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers in the spring, followed by bright red fruits that persist into winter. Cotoneaster kitaibelii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade conditions.
